dataset.title: Traffic Count Database System
dataset.description: MORPC’s Traffic Count Database System allows agencies to share traffic count data with the public instantaneously. The system, which is part of the MORPC Transportation Data Management System, is the result of a multi-jurisdictional effort in modernizing traffic count data sharing in the Central Ohio region. Five agencies—Franklin County, City of Columbus, Delaware County, Licking County Area Transportation Study and Ohio Department of Transportation (ODOT)—directly input traffic counts into the system, and MORPC collects and inputs traffic counts from private consultants and other local governments across the region. Users can retrieve traffic count data by entering specific criteria or by clicking a location on the built-in Google Map.

dataset.title: 2016 - 2040 Active Transportation Plan Web Map
dataset.description: The Active Transportation Plan (ATP) was created as part of the 2016-2040 Metropolitan Transportation Plan to help identify regionally significant active transportation projects that include pedestrian, bicycle, and transit accommodation. The ATP interactive map is a tool to help identify appropriate project types. It includes data about bikeways, bus routes, sidewalks, points of interest, crash data, and more.

dataset.title: SFY 2018-2021 Transportation Improvement Program Web Map
dataset.description: The TIP interactive map is designed to receive comments on MORPC's Draft Transportation Improvement Program for State Fiscal Years 2018-2021. The TIP is a schedule of transportation improvements in the MORPC transportation planning area. The TIP includes investments in highways, public transit, bikeways, pedestrian facilities, bridges, traffic signals and other aspects of the transportation system over a four-year period. It also includes planning and engineering studies that may lead to construction in later years.

dataset.title: Sidewalk Inventory
dataset.description: This sidewalk dataset is a comprehensive transportation network of over 221,000 features representing existing sidewalks, existing crosswalks (marked/unmarked), and sidewalk gaps and matches the cardinality of unique Location-Based Reference System (LBRS) road centerline databases for Franklin, Delaware, Fairfield, and Licking Counties in Ohio. All data was digitized in Esri ArcGIS 10.2.1 software in the Ohio South State Plane (NAD 83), feet projection. This sidewalk inventory is intended for planning purposes only. TranSystems does not warrant the accurateness of the sidewalks or crosswalks depicted in this dataset. None of the sidewalk or crosswalk segments have been field verified. Every reasonable effort has been made to reflect the correct GIS segmentation of all sidewalks, crosswalks, and sidewalk gaps. MORPC will facilitate the maintenance of this data by engaging local governments.

dataset.title: Columbus Metro Bike Map - Web Version
dataset.description: The Columbus Metro Bike Map was updated in 2016 with input from the bicycling community to help cyclists determine which roads may be best suited for their skill level, in the Greater Franklin County area. The roads, indicating Level of Comfort, are color-coded for non-rush hour travel with green as “Good”, orange as “Moderate", and red as “Poor”.

dataset.title: 2000-2010 Census Web Map
dataset.description: Using this map, you can see how the population of Central Ohio has changed over the past decade by comparing 2000 and 2010 Census Block Groups.

dataset.title: ITS Architecture
dataset.description: Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) refers to an assortment of technologies, system infrastructure, and transportation management concepts such as coordinated signal systems, dynamic message signs, ramp meter signals on the freeway, CCTV traffic cameras, and transit related systems. ITS plays a key role in a safe, efficient, and innovative transportation system that works for all travelers. While each stakeholder agency, company, or group owns, operates, maintains or plans ITS systems in the region, the Central Ohio Regional ITS Architecture web site represents a clearinghouse of shared information and resources to provide a safer, more efficient, and more effective transportation system for travelers in the region.

dataset.title: Smart Works
dataset.description: On September 29, 2015 the Franklin County Commission approved a package that completed the extension of the new Smart Works economic development program. The Smart Works suite of programs is divided into three new sections: Infrastructure, People, and Energy.  In addition, Smart Works will enhance existing Economic Development and Planning Department programs.  This applications highlights the Smart Works story.
